Literature Review: Meta-analysis has emerged as a robust methodological approach in organizational research, enabling researchers to synthesize findings from multiple studies and draw more reliable conclusions. This literature review explores the key decision points in conducting a meta-analysis, focusing on the processes of obtaining a common metric, accounting for psychometric artifacts, and selecting an appropriate statistical model. Each of these aspects is crucial for ensuring the validity and reliability of the meta-analytic results.
